definition: a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1],個|个[ge4]
Tibet/Xizang 西藏
storehouse/depository/Buddhist or Taoist scripture
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
lovable/pampered/tender/delicate/frail
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
fight to the death/desperate struggle
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
red in the face/extremely angry
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
